thread.title: Utah hands TCU first home loss, snaps the Frogs' 9-0 streak at home
thread.title_full: Utah hands TCU first home loss, snaps the Frogs' 9-0 streak at home

author: Cecilia Le
title: Utah hands TCU first home loss, snaps the Frogs' 9-0 streak at home
text:
Utah spoiled TCU menâ€™s basketball perfect home record with a 73-65 victory Wednesday night at Schollmaier Arena.
The loss marked TCUâ€™s first home defeat of the season after starting 9-0 under head coach Jamie Dixon, who remains three wins shy of 500 career victories. Utahâ€™s defense proved too much for the Horned Frogs, who struggled offensively throughout the night, shooting just 38% from the field and 35% from beyond the arc.
Guard Vasean Allette , who led all scorers with 19 points, said he felt like Utah had played harder than TCU and they wanted it more.
Noah Reynolds , TCUâ€™s leading scorer this season, tied with senior guard Brendan Wenzel at 12 points.
â€œ[The Utah Utes] are really good positional defenders,â€ Reynolds said. â€œThey did a really good job squeezing the lane with their length. It was difficult to get to the rim on them.â€
let VA cook ðŸ§‘â€ðŸ³ | @PottingerVasean pic.twitter.com/dzsnsQPRkx
â€” TCU Menâ€™s Basketball (@TCUBasketball) January 16, 2025
Despite forcing 13 Utah turnovers while committing only eight, TCU couldnâ€™t capitalize on the advantage, scoring just seven points off those takeaways. The Horned Frogs did show effort on the offensive glass, pulling down 15 offensive rebounds to Utahâ€™s nine.
The Utes demonstrated their passing prowess with 18 assists on 24 made field goals. They built their largest lead of 14 points midway through the second half at 45-31 before TCU mounted a late comeback attempt that ultimately fell short. The Utes maintained their advantage thanks to efficient shooting, finishing at 49% from the field.
Looking ahead, the Horned Frogs travel to Waco, Texas and face No. 25 Baylor on Sunday. Reynolds sees the road matchup as an opportunity for redemption.
â€œAnytime that you get the opportunity to play against a top 25 opponent in this league, it is huge,â€ Reynolds said. â€œEspecially on the road, itâ€™s definitely a great opportunity for us. If you canâ€™t get up for that game, you shouldnâ€™t be here.â€
Tipoff is set for 4 p.m. on Sunday at Foster Pavilion. The game broadcasts on ESPN.
